message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.NI 

Reasoning: The paper discusses a problem related to accessing memory in a neural network, which falls under the category of neural networks and machine learning. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the author's earlier method, which involves spreading activity among neighboring neurons, making it relevant to the sub-category of machine learning, cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the association of fragments with single neurons, which is related to the sub-category of artificial intelligence, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses the open issues associated with the approach, which is relevant to the sub-category of systems and control, cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper discusses the retrieval of memory from single neurons, which is related to the sub-category of neural and information processing systems, cs.NI (Neural and Information Processing Systems).
